intro: Mouriri gonavensis, commonly known as the Gonave Mouriri, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. The plant is adapted to coastal and dry forest environments, showing resilience to salt spray and drought.
